briefTitle: Dose-optimization in Adolescents Aged 13-17 Diagnosed With Attention-deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD) Using Extended-release Guanfacine HCl
officialTitle: A Phase 3, Double-blind, Randomized, Multi-center, Placebo Controlled, Dose-optimization Study Evaluating the Safety, Efficacy, and Tolerability of Once Daily Dosing With Extended-release Guanfacine Hydrochloride in Adolescents Aged 13-17 Years Diagnosed With Attention-deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD)
summary: To assess the efficacy of optimized Extended-release Guanfacine Hydrochloride compared with placebo in the treatment of adolescents aged 13-17 years with a diagnosis of ADHD as measured by the ADHD-RS-IV

primaryOutcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder Rating Scale-fourth Edition (ADHD-RS-IV) Total Score at Week 13
